name: ‚õèÔ∏è Coal Mine Trading Desk

shopkeeper.name: Grimsby Coalhand
shopkeeper.bio: A grizzled veteran miner turned merchant, face permanently stained with coal dust. Lost three fingers to a cave-in but never his business sense.
shopkeeper.personality: Mean and uncaring, Gruff, practical, and skeptical of anything he can't hold in his remaining seven fingers. Respects hard work above all else.

idleDialogue: The children yearn for the mines...
Keep mining!
Coal dust gets everywhere...
*-Scratches Balls.*
*~Yawns*
The One Pick? Bah! Fairy tales for greenhorns...
My granddad swore he saw The Miner King once... drunk fool.
They say The One Pick could crack the world itself... nonsense!
failureTooPoor: If you're broke get out of here!

name: üü® Topaz Mine Trading Desk

shopkeeper.name: Aurelius Goldgleam
shopkeeper.bio: Former jeweler to nobility, now running the topaz trade after a scandal involving counterfeit gems forced him underground.
shopkeeper.personality: Optimistic and flamboyant, with an eye for quality and a weakness for gossip. Believes in luck and fortune.

idleDialogue: Golden opportunities await!
These gems shine bright!
Topaz brings good fortune!
*-Polishes gems*
*~Admires the sparkle*
Some say The One Pick gleams brighter than any topaz...
If The Miner King's pickaxe exists, it would be a sight to behold!
Perhaps one day someone will find where The One Pick rests...
failureTooPoor: If you're broke get out of here!

name: üíé Diamond Mine Trading Shop

shopkeeper.name: Lady Crystalline Devere
shopkeeper.bio: Mysterious aristocrat who controls the diamond trade with silk gloves and an iron will. Rumors say she murdered her husband for his mine claims.
shopkeeper.personality: Refined, calculating, and utterly ruthless in business. Speaks in honeyed tones while mentally counting profits.

idleDialogue: Diamonds are forever!
The finest cuts available!
These stones are flawless!
*-Inspects diamond clarity*
*~Whistles impressed*
Even diamond cannot dull The One Pick's edge... allegedly.
The Miner King's tool would make these diamonds look like glass.
I'd trade my entire stock just to glimpse The One Pick...
failureTooPoor: If you're broke get out of here!

name: üçÉ Emerald Cavern Bazaar

shopkeeper.name: Verdania Mosswhisper
shopkeeper.bio: Half-elf druid who discovered the emerald caverns while following underground root systems. Claims the stones speak to her.
shopkeeper.personality: Mystical, serene, and slightly unhinged. Often speaks in riddles and treats gems like living beings.

idleDialogue: Green is the color of prosperity!
These emeralds pulse with energy!
Feel the power of nature!
*-Caresses emerald*
*~Hums mystically*
The earth whispers of The One Pick in forgotten tongues...
Nature herself bent to The Miner King's will, they say.
When the stones dream, they dream of that legendary pickaxe...
failureTooPoor: The forest does not favor the poor!

name: üåã Ruby Depths Emporium

shopkeeper.name: Ignis Burnbrand
shopkeeper.bio: Dwarf forge-master who mines rubies from active lava tubes. His beard is singed at the edges and his eyes glow with reflected fire.
shopkeeper.personality: Passionate, hot-tempered, and prone to dramatic gestures. Takes personal offense at lowball offers.

idleDialogue: Feel the heat of these rubies!
Forged in fire and passion!
Blood-red treasures await!
*-Wipes sweat*
*~Fans self*
The One Pick was forged in flames that would melt these rubies...
Some claim The Miner King still walks the deepest shafts...
Fire remembers... fire knows where The One Pick sleeps.
failureTooPoor: The forge burns only for the wealthy!

name: üó°Ô∏è Obsidian Forge Marketplace

shopkeeper.name: Shadowblade Vex
shopkeeper.bio: Former assassin who retired to volcanic mining after a job went wrong. Still wears all black and speaks in whispers.
shopkeeper.personality: Brooding, intense, and darkly philosophical. Has an unsettling habit of testing blade sharpness while talking.

idleDialogue: Volcanic glass, sharp as death!
Forged in the earth's fury!
Black as night, hard as diamond!
*-Sharpens obsidian*
*~Tests blade edge*
The One Pick carved through obsidian like shadow through light...
In the volcanic depths, old miners speak The Miner King's name.
This obsidian remembers... it remembers The One Pick's bite.
failureOther: You test my patience like lava tests stone!

name: üåå Mythril Sanctum Treasury

shopkeeper.name: High Keeper Celestius
shopkeeper.bio: Ancient monk who guards the mythril deposits as a sacred duty. Claims to be over 200 years old, blessed by the metal's properties.
shopkeeper.personality: Ethereal, wise, and insufferably pretentious. Judges customers' 'spiritual worthiness' before sales.

idleDialogue: Blessed mythril, gift of the gods!
This metal sings with ancient power!
Only the worthy may handle mythril!
*-Chants softly*
*~Glows faintly*
The One Pick was blessed by gods now forgotten...
Ancient texts speak of The Miner King's ascension...
When mythril sings, it sings for The One Pick's return.
successSell: The ancients smile upon this trade!
failureTooPoor: The gods favor only the prosperous!

name: üåë Adamantite Abyss Vault

shopkeeper.name: The Voidkeeper
shopkeeper.bio: No one knows their real name or face. They emerged from the deepest shafts years ago, changed. Now they speak only in echoes.
shopkeeper.personality: Alien, cryptic, and deeply unsettling. May not be entirely human anymore. Refers to themselves in third person.

idleDialogue: Adamantite... the ultimate metal!
Harder than reality itself!
This ore transcends mortal understanding!
*-Speaks in whispers*
*~Emanates dark energy*
The One Pick exists between existence and void...
The Miner King transcended... became something... else.
In the abyss, all paths lead to The One Pick... or from it.
failureTooPoor: The void has no use for the impoverished!
failureOther: You dare disturb the eternal depths?!

name: üî® Copper Quarry Exchange

shopkeeper.name: Chuck 'Copper' McGillian
shopkeeper.bio: Blue-collar family man who inherited the quarry from his father. Has six kids and a mortgage, just trying to make an honest living.
shopkeeper.personality: Down-to-earth, friendly, and relentlessly practical. Doesn't have time for legends when there's work to be done.

idleDialogue: Honest copper for honest folk!
Reliable metal, reliable profits!
The backbone of civilization!
*-Hammers copper*
*~Hums work songs*
The One Pick? Just a story to keep apprentices working harder.
My pa said his pa said he knew a guy who saw The Miner King...
Legends don't mine copper, friend. Real picks do.
failureOther: Time is copper, don't waste it!

name: ‚öîÔ∏è Iron Stronghold Armory

shopkeeper.name: General Magnus Ironforge
shopkeeper.bio: Retired military commander who turned his tactical mind to iron trading. Still runs his shop like a military operation.
shopkeeper.personality: Disciplined, honorable, and intimidating. Expects customers to show proper respect and punctuality.

idleDialogue: Strong iron for strong souls!
Forged for battle, tested in fire!
The foundation of empires!
*-Tests iron strength*
*~Clangs metal*
No armor could stop The One Pick's swing, they claim.
The Miner King conquered stone kingdoms without a single sword.
Iron bends to will... but The One Pick bent will itself.
successBuy: Built to last, priced to sell!

name: üîÆ Crystal Grotto Emporium

shopkeeper.name: Prisma the Seer
shopkeeper.bio: Fortune teller who discovered she could hear prophecies in crystal vibrations. May actually be psychic, or just very observant.
shopkeeper.personality: Mystical, dramatic, and prone to sudden 'visions' that conveniently suggest customers buy more expensive items.

idleDialogue: Crystals sing with magical energy!
Each shard holds ancient power!
Rainbow light, rainbow profits!
*-Listens to crystals*
*~Sparkles mysteriously*
The crystals show visions... a pickaxe that unmakes and remakes...
I've seen The Miner King in crystal dreams... or have I?
Every facet reflects The One Pick differently... which is true?

name: ü¶¥ Fossil Excavation Museum

shopkeeper.name: Professor Ptolemy Dustborn
shopkeeper.bio: Eccentric archaeologist who got lost in the mines twenty years ago and decided to stay. Has written seventeen unpublished papers.
shopkeeper.personality: Academic, absent-minded, and obsessively detailed. Gets more excited about fossil dating methods than profits.

idleDialogue: History for sale!
Ancient treasures, modern prices!
The past meets the present!
*-Brushes fossils*
*~Studies ancient texts*
No fossil record of The One Pick... curious, isn't it?
The Miner King predates our oldest findings... impossible, yet...
History is written by survivors. The Miner King wrote nothing.
successSell: A piece of history changes hands!
successBuy: Preserving the past, one purchase at a time!
failureTooPoor: Even ancient history has modern prices!

name: üç∫ Miner's Inn Tavern üé∂

shopkeeper.name: Big Martha Brewstone
shopkeeper.bio: Former mine forewoman who opened the tavern after saving a year's wages. Known for her bone-crushing hugs and secret stew recipe.
shopkeeper.personality: Warm, maternal, and tough as nails. Has thrown out men twice her size and nursed back twice as many from cave-sickness.

idleDialogue: Pull up a stool, friend! First round's never free though!
Fresh meat stew on the fire, just like the deep diggers love it!
These tunnels echo with more than just pickaxes at night...
*-Wipes down the bar with a grimy cloth*
*~Pours another ale*
Had a fellow in here swearing he found The One Pick... 'course he was three sheets to the wind.
The Miner King? Ha! After enough ale, everyone's seen him!
They say The One Pick's hidden in a place no living soul can reach... probably just means it's at the bottom of a tankard!
Best cure for cave-blindness? A warm bed and a cold drink!
Every scar has a story, every story needs a drink!
successSell: Pleasure doing business! Now, how about an ale?
successBuy: That'll keep you going in the depths!
failureTooPoor: No coin, no comfort! The mines are that way!
This ain't a charity house, friend!
failureOther: I run an inn, not a circus!

name: üèπ Hunter's Lodge Tavern ü¶å

shopkeeper.name: Selis 'Hawkeye' Greywind
shopkeeper.bio: Former [Ranger Captain] who retired after losing her left arm to a Wyvern. Opened the lodge with her savings and now manages it with the same precision she once tracked prey. Still deadly with a crossbow despite the handicap.
shopkeeper.personality: Practical, observant, and protective of her regular patrons. Has a soft spot for young adventurers but zero tolerance for troublemakers. Speaks in clipped, military-style sentences and notices everything.

idleDialogue: Fresh venison from this morning's hunt!
The forest whispers of strange movements lately...
Eat up! You'll need strength for the trails ahead.
*-Sharpens a hunting knife one-handed*
*~Adjusts a mounted griffin head on the wall*
Saw fresh Razorbeak tracks near the eastern ridge. Best avoid that path.
That [Hunter's Eye] Skill of mine still works, even in retirement.
My Hunter's Brew will put hair on your chest and sharpen your aim!
The One Pick? Ha! Give me a good bow over any pickaxe.
Used to hunt with a fellow who claimed he saw The Miner King... poor soul was never the same.
successSell: That'll keep you on the trail.
successBuy: May it serve you well in the wilds.
failureTooPoor: No coin, no comfort. The wilderness taught me that.

name: üëë Noble's Rest Establishment üéá

shopkeeper.name: Lord Percival Ashworth III
shopkeeper.bio: Third son of House Ashworth, he was disinherited for 'conduct unbecoming' (he fell in love with a commoner). Now runs the finest establishment in the district with his [Innkeeper Lord] class, serving nobility while secretly funding orphanages with the profits.
shopkeeper.personality: Impeccably mannered, secretly compassionate, and absolutely intolerant of poor etiquette. Maintains noble bearing while harboring democratic ideals. Uses his [Noble's Presence] skill to maintain order without raising his voice.

idleDialogue: Only the finest vintages grace our cellars.
Excellence is not an act, but a habit, as they say.
Our Royal Feast is prepared by a [Master Chef] from the capital.
*-Polishes a crystal goblet to perfection*
*~Adjusts his silk cravat*
The Duke of Marlowe dined here last week. Complimented the wine selection.
My [Noble's Grace] ensures every guest feels like royalty.
Even The Miner King would remove his helm in an establishment such as this.
The One Pick? A commoner's fantasy. True power lies in connections, not tools.
We cater to those who appreciate the finer things... and can afford them.
successBuy: Exquisite taste, if I may say.
failureTooPoor: Perhaps the common taverns would better suit your... budget.
I'm afraid our establishment requires certain standards.
failureOther: Perhaps you've mistaken us for a lesser establishment.
